fields.description:
For example, the gallery's control buttons are no longer visible.

To reproduce:
1. Go to a page using the gallery macro.
2. Click on an image.

The controls are no longer shown. There used to be a left and right arrow for scrolling through the images in the gallery, and a X for closing it.  Without these, it is not obvious to a user what to do. They should be restored.

fields.description:
Go to a page using the gallery macro.

Click on an image.

Close the image by clicking outside the border, *not* by pressing the Escape key.

Now use shortcuts Ctrl+left-arrow (Windows) or alt+left-arrow (OSX)

These shortcuts will cause the gallery images to reappear. This can be very annoying, as these shortcuts are also used to navigate through text.

fields.description:
Move a page, and select a space to which the user does not have 'create page' permission.

The move will fail with the error:

{noformat}    You are not permitted to perform this operation.{noformat}

The same error is given if you edit a page, select the new space, and then try to save the change.

This error text is not very helpful - it doesn't say what the operation is, or why it isn't permitted.  It should explain clearer to the user why they cannot move the page.

Also, why is the dialog allowing you to select spaces which are invalid anyway?  Shouldn't they be suppressed from the dialog if the user cannot move a page there?
fields.summary: Error message is unhelpful when trying to move page to a space for which you don't have permissions

Improve the thread dump process so:

fields.description:
With the Drag and Drop plugin disabled, uses can highlight text in the RTE and move it around the page.

With the plugin enabled, this is no longer possible - if a user tries to drag and drop text they will get the message about it not being a valid file. 

This means that using the plugin prevents a convenient way of editing text, which may upset some users.

fields.description:
To add a bit of oomph to the Office Connector, we should add a dynamic sorting function to Office Connector's viewfile Excel tables.

The idea being: to allow the user the ability to click on any heading name, and automatically sort the table by that columns values in a toggable ascending/descending order.
fields.summary: Add dynamic sorting function to Office Connector's viewfile Excel tables

fields.description:
It seems that the viewfile macro renders Excel default fonts in an excessively large font size, creating an overall poor look and feel. I mean, who likes excessively large font sizes? I mean really? :)

I did some experimentation and it looks like we may need to simply reduce the rendered font size by 2. 

I changed the font size down to 8 (saved from Office 2008 in Office 97 format on Mac). That appears to render in a reasonably professional looking size. The problem is that the default font size is 10. So, if we can get it to render Excel's with a font size of 10, in the same way that the font size of 8 currently renders in, we should be laughing.
 
Flagging as major priority as it affects the overall user experience.
fields.summary: Office Connector renderes Excel fonts sizes in a overly large font (~ reduce rendered font sizes by 2)

fields.description:
I didn't find a better place to file this bug report, so here it goes.

In a confluence plugin I had a need to use a jaxws client. I specified my maven dependencies and everything worked fine until I deployed my v2 plugin into confluence. Felix started complaining that it couldn't find certain classes from the jaxws api. Upon further investigation I realized that the jaxws-api artifact in your mirror (which takes precedence over other repos) is indeed missing some classes and differs from the JSR api.

Your artifact: https://maven.atlassian.com/content/groups/public/javax/xml/ws/jaxws-api/2.1/
Official artifact: http://download.java.net/maven/1/javax.xml.ws/jars/

The diff:

{noformat}
$ diff -u jaxws-2_1-mrel2-api.jar.toc jaxws-api-2.1.jar.1.toc 
--- jaxws-2_1-mrel2-api.jar.toc	2009-11-02 16:14:43.000000000 -0800
+++ jaxws-api-2.1.jar.1.toc	2009-11-03 11:43:24.000000000 -0800
@@ -18,12 +18,13 @@
 javax/xml/ws/Endpoint.class
 javax/xml/ws/EndpointReference.class
 javax/xml/ws/FaultAction.class
+javax/xml/ws/Feature.class
+javax/xml/ws/FeatureParameter.class
 javax/xml/ws/Holder.class
 javax/xml/ws/LogicalMessage.class
 javax/xml/ws/ProtocolException.class
 javax/xml/ws/Provider.class
 javax/xml/ws/RequestWrapper.class
-javax/xml/ws/RespectBinding.class
 javax/xml/ws/RespectBindingFeature.class
 javax/xml/ws/Response.class
 javax/xml/ws/ResponseWrapper.class
@@ -51,18 +52,14 @@
 javax/xml/ws/handler/soap/SOAPMessageContext.class
 javax/xml/ws/http/HTTPBinding.class
 javax/xml/ws/http/HTTPException.class
-javax/xml/ws/soap/Addressing.class
 javax/xml/ws/soap/AddressingFeature.class
-javax/xml/ws/soap/MTOM.class
 javax/xml/ws/soap/MTOMFeature.class
 javax/xml/ws/soap/SOAPBinding.class
 javax/xml/ws/soap/SOAPFaultException.class
 javax/xml/ws/spi/FactoryFinder.class
 javax/xml/ws/spi/Provider.class
 javax/xml/ws/spi/ServiceDelegate.class
-javax/xml/ws/spi/WebServiceFeatureAnnotation.class
 javax/xml/ws/wsaddressing/W3CEndpointReference$Address.class
 javax/xml/ws/wsaddressing/W3CEndpointReference$Elements.class
 javax/xml/ws/wsaddressing/W3CEndpointReference.class
-javax/xml/ws/wsaddressing/W3CEndpointReferenceBuilder.class
 javax/xml/ws/wsaddressing/package-info.class
{noformat}
fields.summary: jaxws-api jar in atlassian's maven repo is incorrect

fields.description:
Hello All,

Calling http://host/json/contentnamesearch.action?query=ü from a Microsoft Windows machine (using the Character Map tool to select Unicode hex: U+00FC for the ü character) causes:
{noformat}
java.util.NoSuchElementException
	at java.util.LinkedList.getLast(LinkedList.java:122)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.contentnames.lucene.LuceneQueryTokenizer.tokenize(LuceneQueryTokenizer.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.actions.ContentNameSearchAction.execute(ContentNameSearchAction.java:100)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:168)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.AroundInterceptor.intercept(AroundInterceptor.java:35)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
{noformat}

The problem doesn't occur on Firefox for Apple OS X but does on the Windows version. 

Cutting and pasting from Firefox for OS X to the Windows Virtual Machine carries over this URL: http://host/json/contentnamesearch.action?query=%C3%BC which works correctly.
The opposite - from Windows to OS X - results in the following URL: http://host/json/contentnamesearch.action?query=%FC which causes the exception.


Best Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: Particular characters in Quick search string cause System Error

fields.description:
A customer uses Confluence XML RPC API to fetch Confluence page content and wishes to authenticate using a crowd token. 

However currently the rpc token authentication is only done with {{com/atlassian/confluence/rpc/auth/TokenAuthenticationManager.java}} which expects a confluence generated token. 

If no token is passed to rpc authentication, then it will use seraph authentication which will go through the request and log in a user based on the information stored in the session. 

However in this case: 

{quote}
This is exactly the problem, in many cases, we do not have a handle to user session information (i.e, no request object). We only pass authentication tokens generated by crowd.
{quote}

The customer suggested that the proper way to fix is to have xml rpc api have a {{CrowdTokenAuthenticationManager.java}} class (configurable when crowd is used) that authenticates with crowd (i.e passes the crowd token to crowd and delegates authentication to crowd) even when token was generated by another crowd client app.

This is reported in 2.10.1 but should also affects 3.0.1 as they are still using the same API.
fields.summary: Confluence XML RPC authentication API does not honor Crowd tokens

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

The message at the top of the *External Gadgets* page (of the 'Administration Console' area) has some typos in it (which I've underlined in the text below):

*Only add gadgets that you trust! Gadgets can allow unwanted or malicious code onto your web page.*

You can add gadgets from Atlassian applications such as Confluence, JIRA and others. You can also add gadgets from other +websitessuch+ as iGoogle. Many public gadgets will work on a Confluence page. Some gadgets may rely +onspecific+ iGoogle features that will not work properly in Confluence.

A +gadgets+ URL looks something like this: http://example.com/my-gadget-location/my-gadget.xml

*Corrections:*

+websitessuch+ -> web sites such

+onspecific+ -> on specific

+gadgets+ -> gadget's
(i.e. with an apostrophe)

----

*At the same time, please implement the following wording improvements:*

Change the heading *Add gadget to directory* to:
*Add gadget to the macro browser*

Change the heading *Remove existing gadget from directory* to:
*Registered gadgets available in the macro browser*

Cheers,
Giles.

fields.description:
h5. Bug Description
When user imports a Word Document using Doc Import feature, they are allowed to use the Advanced feature whereby they can perform various configuration changes. One of the changes that they can perform would be changing the Page Title. However, there's no validation check if the Root page title is left empty. Due to this, Confluence can have a page without title which is not standard across the application. 

h5. Further findings
# When using MySQL, a page inserted to Confluence by employing this bug, will result in an entry in the content table with an empty string in the title field
# However, when using Oracle, since Oracle doesn't support empty string, it will store it as null. This results in various problem such as [this|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/NullPointerException+when+editing+page+restrictions], problem deleting the page and even editing the page.

h5. Screenshots
* [^DocImportAdvanced.png]
* [^EmptyPageTitle.png]
* [^PageNoTitle.png]
* [^PageTreeEmpty.png]
fields.summary: Doc Import allows empty title

fields.description:
*NOTE*: Marked as critical as it breaks plugin backwards compatibility

Somebody had fun with {{TaskQueueFlushJob}} ;-)

I think the intention is to handle everything through setters however there is no (documented) option to set the queue name. So what has to happen is either or these:
* Make {{TaskQueueFlushJob}} backwards compatible and use {{abstract String getKeyName()}} again
* Leave it the way it is (*ouch!*) but allow for the queueName to be set in the {{job}} module type (using the module key?)

Also, the documentation has to be updated. 

Note that there is no way of defining jobs using the {{spring}} module type, see  [my comment|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Job+Plugins?focusedCommentId=199852069#comment-199852069]
fields.summary: TaskQueueFlushJob not longer uses abstract getQueueName method to set the queue name

fields.description:
If you set a content property within an transaction, this property gets persisted even if the transaction gets rolled back.
I've attached a patch for an integration test which shows the problem.
fields.summary: Changes to content properties don't get rolled back

fields.description:
When user tries to do search via quick search. Once, user types any character, the [quick search aid|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Searching+Confluence#SearchingConfluence-UsingtheQuickNavigationAid] will help you by listing down the related pages. However, the quich search aid will be hanging if we type umlaut character.

The steps to reproduce the problem:
# Created a page which title is *Umlaut ä Test*. Do content indexing.
# Type word *Umlaut* on the quick search and the quick navigation aid lists down the correct page title which is *Umlaut ä Test*
# Type word *Umlaut ä*, the quick navigation aid hangs
# Type word *Umlaut ä XXXX* (continue from the above step), the quick navigation aid keeps hanging.
fields.summary: Quick navigation aid will be hanging if we type umlaut character

fields.description:
The mechanism in Confluence for creating custom decorators makes for a very brittle upgrade process. To take the example of a custom page decorator. You take a copy of the current page.vmd and paste it in to the Custom layout screen where you can then customize it.

After a Confluence upgrade, if the page.vmd has changed in the new version, there's a good chance that some page related operations will now be broken as the customised page.vmd stays in the Db.

At the very least we could flag during the upgrade process that there are customisations that should be manually checked.
fields.summary: Custom decorator mechanism (Custom layout) can easily cause upgrade problems
Provide helpful message to user when uploading plugin fails due to low max_allowed_packet setting in MySQL

fields.description:
The INDEXQUEUEENTRIES should be cleaned at 2am every day, when the index queue clean job runs. 

The job basically runs the query 

{code:sql}
delete from INDEXQUEUEENTRIES where CREATIONDATE < ?"
{code}

Where ? is a date which is 2 days earlier (essentially remove all enteries more than 2 days old). 

However while this runs, the transaction is not committed immediately and in some customer cases it never gets committed and hence the table is never cleaned.
fields.summary: INDEXQUEUEENTRIES table not being cleaned despite the index queue clean job being running at 2am every day with no errors

fields.description:
I haven't tried this in m6 yet, as I found it on the plane on my way home, but this one is a doozy, it's also been around for a while (I originally noticed it with 2.10.3, but it may well reach back earlier)

Steps to reproduce:
1. Install a vanilla confluence (I have tried with 3.1-m5 & 2.10.3)
2. Create a space (or use the 'ds' space)
3. Go into space admin, set the theme to left-nav (this should work with any non-default theme)
4. Go back to the home page of the space, copy the url and open a new tab
5. Paste the url into the address bar of the new tab and change the case of the spacekey, assuming the 'ds' space is used, set the spacekey to 'DS'

Result:
The content for the space is correctly shown however it appears to have been rendered with main.vmd not page.vmd :o
fields.summary: invalid spacekey CaSe causes wrong decorator to be applied

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17392].
  {panel}

None of the objects available when creating user macro seems to provide access to the SpaceManager object. 

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/User+Macros

This forces me to use deprecated apis. 

Seems a simple change to expose this API somehow.
fields.summary: getSpaceManager api required in user macro context

They aren't all that useful, since resizing the table isn't saved, but that's the topic of other bugs.  The controls are misaligned, so that they don't appear on the table border like they're meant to.  Screenshot attached.

fields.description:
My RTE isn't fully rendering on EAC. Among other things, table borders aren't rendering and the font is remaining on the browser default Times New Roman.

I think this began after I upgraded to Firefox 3.5.4 this morning. I've tested it on CAC with the same browser and it works fine. It also works fine in Safari.

fields.description:
Please compare the result [one|http://confluence.atlassian.com/dosearchsite.action?queryString=JIRA+%E3%83%A6%E3%83%BC%E3%82%B6%E3%83%BC%E4%BC%9A] and [two|http://confluence.atlassian.com/dosearchsite.action?queryString=JIRA%E3%80%80%E3%83%A6%E3%83%BC%E3%82%B6%E3%83%BC%E4%BC%9A].

Basically, both queries are same, but the latter one does not return any result because the space between two words is full width.

Steps to reproduce:
# Prepare environment for double byte letters, and enable double byte mode (such Japanese).
# Put the full width space between the query words given in the above example.
# Run search.

This is a serious problem for all the users using double byte mode, which does not occur in search engines like Google. 

Is it possible to fix this issue in Confluence?

Regards,
JP Support.
fields.summary: Full-width space is not interpreted as "and"

fields.description:
According to [this doc from w3|http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/struct/links.html#adef-name-A], the "a name" tag must be unique: {quote} This attribute names the current anchor so that it may be the destination of another link. The value of this attribute must be a unique anchor name. The scope of this name is the current document... {quote} We are not making this unique at the moment. So the following wiki markup: {code} h1. title 1 h3. subtitle a h3. subtitle b h1. title 2 h3. subtitle a h3. subtitle b {code} Will result in the following: {code}

title 1

subtitle a

subtitle a

title 2

subtitle a

subtitle a

{code} The subtitles are not made unique, which is not following the standard.
fields.summary: Anchor Name must be unique following the HTML 4 standard
MacroMetadataParser ignores all attributes for macros without parameters

fields.description:
I tried highlighting "JIRA 4 & Confluence 3.1 OpenSocial Gadgets" to add a link in the RTE on EAC.

The link alias becomes 'JIRA 4' - I suspect due to the ampersand.

Adding a link and hitting save changes the original highlighted text to "JIRA 4"

fields.description:
{{ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator}} no longer adds LDAP users to {{confluence-users}} group, if they already have the {{Can Use}} permission via another group or individual global permission.
LDAP users should be added to the {{confluence-users}} group, if configured to use the {{ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator}}, irrespective of their current group memberships or permissions.
fields.summary: ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator does not add users to confluence-users group, if they already have "Can Use" permission via another group

fields.description:
Edit the maximum size for attachments in the Admin Console.

Use the new image dialog to try to upload a file which is larger than the allowed size.

The following error is given:

{noformat}You are not permitted to attach files to this space.{noformat}


This message is incorrect, and could cause confusion.
fields.summary: Incorrect error is given when user tries to upload an image which is larger than the maximum size allowed

fields.description:
Upload an attachment to a page, and log in as a user without permission to create attachments in the space.

The user can view the attachments page, and select 'Properties' from the dialog. This makes it look as though they are able to edit the properties. When they try to save, an error is given:

{noformat} You do not have permission to move this attachment to the space SPACENAME. {noformat}

This error is confusing - it doesn't explain to the user what the real problem is.
fields.summary: Attachments dropdown allows users to access edit screen without permission, and gives confusing error

fields.description:
Upload an image to a page, and include the following in the attachment comment:

{noformat}<script>alert('vulnerable')</script>{noformat}


Now display the image using the gallery macro. When the full-size picture is viewed, the script in the comment will be executed.


See example here: https://qa-cac.atlassian.com/display/~mhrynczak/xss+in+gallery
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability can be exploited using the Gallery macro

fields.description: Strange, i thought I had created an issue for this, but possibly not. anyway, after the bugs are fixed and tests written, the widget should be in by beta1 on Friday.
fields.summary: Add Dashboard widget to allow easy creation of pages and posts right from the Dashboard

fields.description:
when using Jiraissues macro in Confluence, the date format is picked up from Jira, though the format changes when the page is received in an email notification. The email refers to Confluence's date format when listing issues from this Confluence page.
In case of Jira *custom* date fields, formatting is completely lost in the email. The format is *not* referenced from either Jira or Confluence's date settings. 

It would be preferable to have a consistent formatting in both locations for both system and custom Jira fields.
fields.summary: Date format mismatch between jiraissues macro and emailed Confluence page
Throw and exception if the key of a bandana entry exceeds a length of 100

fields.description:
Use the image dialog to enter the url for a web image, and select the 'thumbnail' checkbox.

On saving the page, this gives an error:

{noformat}Can only create thumbnails for attached images{noformat}


The dialog should prevent the user form being able to create invalid markup - i.e. the checkbox should be greyed out when entering a web image.
fields.summary: Image dialog should not allow thumbnail to be selected for web images

fields.description:
Enable captchas.

Add a new page, upload an image, and insert it on the page.

Try to save the page, but with an incorrect attempt at the captcha.

The page fails to save, and the uploaded image will no longer be inserted on the page.
fields.summary: Uploaded images are lost when a captcha is entered incorrectly
Uploaded images are not displayed in the RTE after trying to save with an invalid title

fields.description:
Login to Confluence, add a page, and use the new image dialog to upload an image.

Navigate away from the page, forcing a draft save.

Add a new page, and open the image dialog. The previously uploaded picture will still be there.

Now log out, and as the anonymous user add a page. Open up the image dialog, and it will try to show the image, but will fail, resulting in the weirdness shown in the screenshot.
fields.summary: Images uploaded to a draft will be available for other pages

fields.description:
Accessing Jira 4.0 issues using the jiraissues macro in Confluence, fails with an error {{Error formatting macro: jiraissues: java.lang.RuntimeException: The value '<Jira Project Key>' does not exist for the field 'project'.}}
Re-loading the page then gives a {{HTTP Status 400}} error in FireFox and crashes Opera.
The user in this case, did not have "Browse Project" permissions for the project from which the issues were being requested from. The username and password were passes in the jiraissues macro URL.

A more meaningful error such as "Insufficient Permissions" would help understand the cause of the problem.

Errors in the logs:
{quote}
2009-10-28 10:24:10,673 ERROR [http-8080-4] [confluence.extra.jira.JiraIssuesServlet] doGet Unexpected Exception, could not retrieve JIRA issues: The value '<Project Key>' does not exist for the field 'project'.
 -- url: /plugins/servlet/issue-retriever | userName: test1 | referer: http://localhost:8080/display/test/jira+space
java.lang.RuntimeException: The value '<Project Key>' does not exist for the field 'project'.
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.jira.DefaultJiraIssuesManager.retrieveXML(DefaultJiraIssuesManager.java:189)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.jira.JiraIssuesServlet.getResultJson(JiraIssuesServlet.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.jira.JiraIssuesServlet.doGet(JiraIssuesServlet.java:98)

2009-10-28 10:27:56,679 ERROR [http-8080-5] [confluence.extra.jira.JiraIssuesManager] retrieveXML Received HTTP 400 from server. Error message: Bad Request
 -- url: /plugins/servlet/issue-retriever | userName: test1 | referer: http://localhost:8080/display/testItest/another+jiraissues+test
2009-10-28 10:27:56,679 ERROR [http-8080-5] [confluence.extra.jira.JiraIssuesServlet] doGet Unexpected Exception, could not retrieve JIRA issues: Bad Request
 -- url: /plugins/servlet/issue-retriever | userName: test1 | referer: http://localhost:8080/display/testItest/another+jiraissues+test
java.lang.RuntimeException: Bad Request
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.jira.DefaultJiraIssuesManager.retrieveXML(DefaultJiraIssuesManager.java:189)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.jira.JiraIssuesServlet.getResultJson(JiraIssuesServlet.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.jira.JiraIssuesServlet.doGet(JiraIssuesServlet.java:98)
{quote}

Putting the user back into the {{jira-users}} group and re-configuring the project permissions, helps resolve the problem.
fields.summary: Jiraissues macro fails with a 400 error in Confluence for a user with insufficient Jira project permissions

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Download Confluence 2.9.3
# Disconnect Internet
# Install Confluence 2.9.3

h5. Problem
# Problem occurs when Spring attempts to resolve http://atlassian.com/schema/spring/plugin.xsd and it is unavailable.
# The following is logged in atlassian-confluece.log:
{code}
2009-10-27 21:46:10,747 WARN [main] [beans.factory.xml.XmlBeanDefinitionReader] warning Ignored XML validation warning
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: schema_reference.4: Failed to read schema document 'http://atlassian.com/schema/spring/plugin.xsd', because 1) could not find the document; 2) the document could not be read; 3) the root element of the document is not <xsd:schema>.

        at org.apache.xerces.util.ErrorHandlerWrapper.warning(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLErrorReporter.reportError(Unknown Source)

        at org.apache.xerces.impl.xs.traversers.XSDHandler.getSchemaDocument(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.xs.traversers.XSDHandler.parseSchema(Unknown Source)

        at org.apache.xerces.impl.xs.XMLSchemaValidator.findSchemaGrammar(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.xs.XMLSchemaValidator.processAttributes(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.xs.XMLSchemaValidator.handleStartElement(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.xs.XMLSchemaValidator.startElement(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLNSDocumentScannerImpl.scanStartElement(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl$FragmentContentDispatcher.dispatch(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.DOMParser.parse(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.DocumentBuilderImpl.parse(Unknown Source)
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.DefaultDocumentLoader.loadDocument(DefaultDocumentLoader.java:73)
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.XmlBeanDefinitionReader.doLoadBeanDefinitions(XmlBeanDefinitionReader.java:361)
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.XmlBeanDefinitionReader.loadBeanDefinitions(XmlBeanDefinitionReader.java:313)
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.XmlBeanDefinitionReader.loadBeanDefinitions(XmlBeanDefinitionReader.java:290)
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanDefinitionReader.loadBeanDefinitions(AbstractBeanDefinitionReader.java:131)
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanDefinitionReader.loadBeanDefinitions(AbstractBeanDefinitionReader.java:147)
        at org.springframework.web.context.support.XmlWebApplicationContext.loadBeanDefinitions(XmlWebApplicationContext.java:124)
        at org.springframework.web.context.support.XmlWebApplicationContext.loadBeanDefinitions(XmlWebApplicationContext.java:92)
        at org.springframework.context.support.AbstractRefreshableApplicationContext.refreshBeanFactory(AbstractRefreshableApplicationContext.java:101)
        at org.springframework.context.support.AbstractApplicationContext.obtainFreshBeanFactory(AbstractApplicationContext.java:394)
        at org.springframework.context.support.AbstractApplicationContext.refresh(AbstractApplicationContext.java:324)
        at org.springframework.web.context.ContextLoader.createWebApplicationContext(ContextLoader.java:246)
        at org.springframework.web.context.ContextLoader.initWebApplicationContext(ContextLoader.java:189)
        at org.springframework.web.context.ContextLoaderListener.contextInitialized(ContextLoaderListener.java:49)
        at com.atlassian.spring.container.ContainerContextLoaderListener.contextInitialized(ContainerContextLoaderListener.java:32)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.ConfluenceBootstrappedContextLoaderListener.contextInitialized(ConfluenceBootstrappedContextLoaderListener.java:111)
 at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:3764)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.start(StandardContext.java:4216)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.start(ContainerBase.java:1014)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHost.start(StandardHost.java:736)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.start(ContainerBase.java:1014)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngine.start(StandardEngine.java:443)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardService.start(StandardService.java:448)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardServer.start(StandardServer.java:700)
        at org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.start(Catalina.java:552)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
        at org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap.start(Bootstrap.java:295)
        at org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap.main(Bootstrap.java:433)
{code}

h5. Findings
# In Confluence 2.9.2 and below, Confluence does not refer to http://atlassian.com/schema/spring/plugin.xsd in its bootstrapContext.xml
# In Confluence 2.9.3, Confluence refers to http://atlassian.com/schema/spring/plugin.xsd in its bootstrapContext.xml and without Internet connection, it is unable to retrieve the required schema.
# In Confluence 2.10 and above, although Confluence refers to http://atlassian.com/schema/spring/plugin.xsd in its bootstrapContext.xml, the problem was solved due to the use of spring.schemas which is located in atlassian-plugins-spring-X.X.X.jar/com/atlassian/plugin/spring/pluginns/:
{code}
http\://atlassian.com/schema/spring/plugin.xsd=com/atlassian/plugin/spring/pluginns/plugin.xsd
{code}

h5. Workaround
# So far the workaround is to just connect to the Internet.
fields.summary: Cannot install Confluence 2.9.3 without Internet connection
